column1: Passed the Senate ✅ USMCA is one step closer to becoming law and providing economic certainty for Hoosier farmers and manufacturers. This updated trade deal is a win for Indiana and our American economy. On to the @POTUS desk! https://t.co/EkQdRTQCRd

I have personally met with the hardworking staff members leading these programs and nonprofit providers including Centerstone in Bloomington pictured here to discuss the housing issues they see in their neighborhoods. https://t.co/hWs9JjuN2M

I spoke with @IIB about today's #JobsReport our strong American economy and our thriving Hoosier economy where employers + businesses are seeing more growth than they thought was possible and employees are seeing wage growth and more careers to choose from → https://t.co/HC7XcV1CpT
If you cross paths with a law enforcement officer be sure to give him or her a quick thank you. https://t.co/2GflzFugZl

Today is #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay a small token of appreciation from a grateful nation to each and every member of our law enforcement. Thank you for your tireless work to keep us our families our neighborhoods our Friday night football games + our borders safe.

Our economy is working for everyone ➡️ pay for the bottom 25% of wage earners rose 4.5% over the past year. Exciting to see our pro-growth policies are paying off and giving everyone the chance to work toward their American Dream:  https://t.co/Y4s4xwE0PD
Glad @SpeakerPelosi finally allowed what we knew would be a strong #bipartisan vote on #USMCA https://t.co/9L0BtXz3ZF https://t.co/cN3V2L3cYg
Now that @SpeakerPelosi has had her vote let’s get back to doing real work for the American people. https://t.co/czvW2xqgci

Tonight I voted NO on the Democrats' 3-year long attempt to overturn the results of the 2016 election of @POTUS. From the start this partisan process the only impeachment along party lines in our history has been about political showmanship not Americans’ priorities.

One year later our Charlestown community still mourns the loss of Sgt. Bertram a dedicated neighbor officer friend brother and son whose legacy of kindness and commitment lives on every day. https://t.co/Oet2MJn5ji
I look forward to supporting this updated 21st century trade deal when it comes to the House floor for a vote. #USMCANow https://t.co/G5D0KRIfTw

American manufacturing and agriculture two defining pieces of our Hoosier economy have been hard hit by trade uncertainty – and have long deserved a level playing field. Thanks to @POTUS leadership the U.S Mexico and Canada have finally come to an agreement on #USMCA.
Solid November Jobs Report:   ✅266000 new jobs ✅50 year unemployment low ✅3.1% wage growth https://t.co/MS6U79DEPp
Waiting for @SpeakerPelosi to bring #USMCA to the floor https://t.co/dpmEwFmSte

November is National Alzheimer’s Disease Awareness Month. I recently sat down w/ volunteers who are advocating for our Hoosier seniors who are battling Alzheimer’s. Thank you for your tireless work; I will continue to support your efforts + senior care here in Congress. #EndAlz https://t.co/M4vf5JTwhb

Yesterday was Veterans Day a day not only to celebrate and thank our country’s veterans but to listen to their stories and learn from their experiences.

I voted against today’s Democrat resolution to deprive @POTUS of his due process and against continuing a partisan investigation. House Democrats have misappropriated a solemn constitutional duty to delegitimize an election and the 62 million voters who supported our President.

Last week marked the anniversary of the SUPPORT Act the single largest congressional effort to tackle the opioid epidemic becoming law. This bill which I voted for reauthorized the Drug-Free Communities Program that helps strengthen our local partners fighting youth drug use.

After 25 years it’s time for NAFTA to be replaced with a 21st century trade agreement to:  ➡️Generate an estimated $34 billion in new auto manufacturing investments ➡️Break down trade barriers for farmers and manufacturers ➡️Create more jobs and raise wages  #USMCANow https://t.co/idzWzD8D2n
